intro: Viguiera macbridei, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces showy, purple to pinkish flower heads that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Viguiera macbridei is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
